translated: this is the skill in means of a bodhisattva great being.

original: rigs kyi bu /

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams yin la / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams nges par 'byung ba ni /
translated: The buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have definitely come forth from the bodhisattvas.

analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams yin no //

analyzed: 'on kyang 'dir ni bdag nyid shin tu mchog dang / shin tu gtso bo yin gyi 'di dag ni ma yin no //

analyzed: 'di dag ni bdag gi pha'i nor gyi phung po la yongs su spyod par byed pa yin pas /

analyzed: de yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i thabs la mkhas pa yin no // rigs kyi bu /

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni ye shes dang ldan lags te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni ye shes dang ldan lags te /

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Reverend Lord,

original: 'od srung / legs so //
analyzed: 'od srung / legs so //

original: 'od srung khyod kyis dpe brjod pa des lha dang mi rnams kyi skye rgu las srog chags khri nyis @104a *//
analyzed: 'od srung khyod kyis dpe brjod pa des lha dang mi rnams kyi skye rgu las srog chags khri nyis @104a *//

original: stong gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
analyzed: stong gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
translated: One thousand bodhisattvas gave rise to the mind of unexcelled and complete awakening.

original: 'od srung / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni thabs la mkhas pa legs par bslabs pa /
analyzed: 'od srung / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni thabs la mkhas pa legs par bslabs pa /
translated: “Kāśyapa, bodhisattva mahāsattvas are well trained in skillful means

original: yon tan dpag tu med pa dang ldan pa yin te /🔽'od srung / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni gang gis bdag la gnod par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: yon tan dpag tu med pa dang ldan pa yin te / 'od srung / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni gang gis bdag la gnod par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: and possess immeasurable qualities.🔽“Kāśyapa, bodhisattva mahāsattvas do not engage in actions that would harm themselves

analyzed: gzhan la gnod par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i las mi byed cing /

analyzed: tshig gang gis bdag dang gzhan la gdung bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i tshig kyang mi smra'o //
translated: They do not speak words that would cause distress to themselves or others.🔽” When this was said, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sublime Wisdom said to the Blessed One,

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ye shes dam pas 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ye shes dam pas 'di skad ces gsol to //

analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad du byang chub sems dpa' ni tshig gang gis bdag dang gzhan la gdung bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i tshig mi smra'o zhes bka' stsal lags na /
translated: Venerable Blessed One, you have said, ‘Bodhisattvas do not speak words that would torment themselves or others.’

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'o na ci'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' skye ba gcig gis thogs pa bram ze'i khye'u 'od zer phreng zhes bgyi bar gyur pa na /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' skye ba gcig gis thogs pa bram ze'i khye'u 'od zer phreng zhes bgyi bar gyur pa na /
translated: then why did the bodhisattva who was hindered by only one birth, when he was the young brahmin called Radiance Garland,

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mar me mdzad kyi gsung rab la 'di skad ces /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mar me mdzad kyi gsung rab la 'di skad ces /
translated: in the teachings of the Blessed One, the thus-gone, worthy, perfect Buddha Dīpaṃkara, say,

original: dge sbyong mgo reg mthong bas kho bo la ci zhig bya /
analyzed: dge sbyong mgo reg mthong bas kho bo la ci zhig bya /
translated: ‘What is the point of my seeing this shaven-headed ascetic?

original: byang chub ni mchog tu rnyed par dka' ba yin pas /
analyzed: byang chub ni mchog tu rnyed par dka' ba yin pas /
translated: Enlightenment is extremely difficult to attain,

original: dge sbyong mgo reg la byang chub ga la yod ces gsungs na /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis de @104b skad ces gsungs pa de ci las dgongs te /
analyzed: dge sbyong mgo reg la byang chub ga la yod ces gsungs na / bcom ldan 'das kyis de @104b skad ces gsungs pa de ci las dgongs te /
translated: so how could this shaven-headed ascetic have it?’🔽Blessed One, what was your intention when you said that?

original: de skad gsungs lags /
analyzed: de skad gsungs lags /
translated: Why did you say that?”🔽“Excellent, excellent, Mañjuśrī!

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ye shes dam pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ye shes dam pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: When this had been said, the Blessed One said to the bodhisattva great being Sublime Wisdom:🔽

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: When he had thus spoken, the Lord said to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sublime Wisdom, “Noble son,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa'i tshad rab tu rnam par dbye bas khyod la ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa'i tshad rab tu rnam par dbye bas khyod la ci zhig bya /
translated: what use is it to you to analyze the extent of the conduct of the tathāgatas and bodhisattvas?🔽Stop!

original: thong zhig / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: thong zhig / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: rigs kyi bu; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni thabs la mkhas pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan pas skyes bu dam pa de dag ni ji lta ji ltar sems can yongs su smin par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar gnas par byed🔽pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni thabs la mkhas pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan pas skyes bu dam pa de dag ni ji lta ji ltar sems can yongs su smin par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar gnas par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Noble son, bodhisattva mahāsattvas are endowed with inconceivable skill in means. Those sublime beings remain in whatever way is necessary to bring sentient beings to maturity.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Noble son,

original: de lta mod kyi 'on kyang legs par rab tu nyon la tshul bzhin du yid la gzung zhig dang / thabs la mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi 'on kyang legs par rab tu nyon la tshul bzhin du yid la gzung zhig dang / thabs la mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs bshad par bya'o //
translated: Nevertheless, listen well and keep it in mind! I will explain the Dharma discourse called The Entry into the Perfection of Skillful Means.

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpas /🔽bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mar me mdzad tshun chad du /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpas / bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mar me mdzad tshun chad du /
translated: How should bodhisattvas🔽understand the inconceivable skillful means that the Blessed One, the thus-gone, worthy, perfect Buddha Dīpaṃkara taught?

original: thabs la mkhas pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa bstan pa gang yin pa de dag las phyogs tsam zhig bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa bstan pa gang yin pa de dag las phyogs tsam zhig bstan par bya ste /
translated: I will teach a mere fraction of those.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Noble son,

original: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mar me mdzad mthong ma thag tu mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i bar der byang chub sems @105a *//
analyzed: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mar me mdzad mthong ma thag tu mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i bar der byang chub sems @105a *//
translated: when the bodhisattva saw the thus-gone, worthy, perfect Buddha Dīpaṃkara, he immediately attained acceptance of the fact that phenomena are nonarising.

original: dpa' ni 'khrug pa med pa dang / ca co med pa dang / brjed pa med pa dang / sems rnam par g-yeng ba med pa dang / shes rab nyams pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: dpa' ni 'khrug pa med pa dang / ca co med pa dang / brjed pa med pa dang / sems rnam par g-yeng ba med pa dang / shes rab nyams pa med pa yin te /
translated: “Heroic” means being without conflict, without chatter, without forgetfulness, without distraction, and without impaired wisdom.

original: rigs kyi bu; mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dod na zhag bdun gyis kyang byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar yang 'gyur /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu; mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dod na zhag bdun gyis kyang byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar yang 'gyur /
translated: “Son of noble family, the bodhisattva who has attained acceptance of the fact that phenomena are not produced can, if he wishes, fully awaken to perfect buddhahood in seven days.

original: 'dod na bskal pas kyang byas chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur /🔽'dod na bskal pa brgyas kyang byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur /🔽'dod na bskal pa stong gis kyang byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dod na bskal pas kyang byas chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur / 'dod na bskal pa brgyas kyang byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur / 'dod na bskal pa stong gis kyang byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur /
translated: If he wishes, he can fully awaken to perfect buddhahood in an eon.🔽If he wishes, he can fully awaken to perfect buddhahood in a hundred eons.🔽If he wishes, he can fully awaken to perfect buddhahood in a thousand eons.

original: 'dod na bskal pa 'bum gyis kyang byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dod na bskal pa 'bum gyis kyang byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur te /
translated: If he wishes, he can fully awaken to perfect buddhahood in a hundred thousand eons.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ni sems can rnams yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ni sems can rnams yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: This bodhisattva, in order to ripen sentient beings,

original: 'dod na bsam bzhin du srid pa la len cing 'gro bar yang byed do //
analyzed: 'dod na bsam bzhin du srid pa la len cing 'gro bar yang byed do //
translated: if he wishes, takes on existence and goes to the realms.

original: de ni thabs la mkhas pa dang shes rab kyi stobs bskyed pas gang gi tshe 'dod pa de'i tshe na /
analyzed: de ni thabs la mkhas pa dang shes rab kyi stobs bskyed pas gang gi tshe 'dod pa de'i tshe na /
translated: By the power of his skill in means and wisdom, when he wishes,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar byed cing /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar byed cing /
translated: he attains manifest, complete enlightenment in unsurpassed, perfect awakening.

original: 'dod na phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i bskal ba brgya phrag mang por yang yid yongs su skyo ba med par gnas par byed de /
analyzed: 'dod na phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i bskal ba brgya phrag mang por yang yid yongs su skyo ba med par gnas par byed de /
translated: If he wishes, he remains for many hundreds of eons, to the end of time, without his mind becoming weary.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: This is the bodhisattva’s skill in means.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: gzhan yang nyan thos kyang zhi ba'i ting nge 'dzin @105b dag la snyoms par 'jug la /
analyzed: gzhan yang nyan thos kyang zhi ba'i ting nge 'dzin @105b dag la snyoms par 'jug la /
translated: the hearers also enter into the samādhi of peace,

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang zhi ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug cing ldang bar byed mod kyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang zhi ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug cing ldang bar byed mod kyi /
translated: The bodhisattva, on the other hand, enters and emerges from the meditative absorptions of tranquility.

original: de'i lus g-yo bar yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i lus g-yo bar yang mi 'gyur /
translated: His body does not move,

original: sems g-yo bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems g-yo bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: nor does his mind move.

original: nyan thos ni bdag nyid yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba kho nar shes par byed kyi /
analyzed: nyan thos ni bdag nyid yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba kho nar shes par byed kyi /
translated: The śrāvaka, on the other hand, is only concerned with his own parinirvāṇa.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni zhi ba'i ting nge 'dzin dag la snyoms par 'jug kyang bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis sems can rnams bsdu ba'i brtson 'grus rgyun mi gcod cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni zhi ba'i ting nge 'dzin dag la snyoms par 'jug kyang bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis sems can rnams bsdu ba'i brtson 'grus rgyun mi gcod cing /
translated: The bodhisattva, even while entering the meditative absorptions of tranquility, does not interrupt his efforts to gather beings through the four means of gathering disciples.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis sems can yongs su smin par byed la /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis sems can yongs su smin par byed la /
translated: He brings beings to maturity through the six perfections.

original: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa na snying rje chen po skyed par yang byed de /
analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa na snying rje chen po skyed par yang byed de /
translated: And while bringing beings to maturity, he generates great compassion.

original: de yang byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: This is the bodhisattva’s skill in means.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family!

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dod na dga' ldan gyi gnas na 'dug bzhin du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya zhing chos kyi 'khor lo skor ba yang byed nus mod kyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dod na dga' ldan gyi gnas na 'dug bzhin du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya zhing chos kyi 'khor lo skor ba yang byed nus mod kyi /
translated: Moreover, if the bodhisattva wishes, he can sit in the Tuṣita Heaven and attain unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment and turn the wheel of the Dharma.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: However, the bodhisattva thinks like this:

original: 'dzam bu'i gling pa'i mi rnams kyis ni chos mnyan pa'i phyir dga' ldan gyi gnas su 'dzeg par mi nus la /
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling pa'i mi rnams kyis ni chos mnyan pa'i phyir dga' ldan gyi gnas su 'dzeg par mi nus la /
translated: “The people of Jambudvīpa cannot climb to the Tuṣita Heaven to listen to the Dharma.

original: lha rnams kyis ni chos mnyan pa'i phyir 'dzam bu'i gling du 'bab par nus so snyam nas /
analyzed: lha rnams kyis ni chos mnyan pa'i phyir 'dzam bu'i gling du 'bab par nus so snyam nas /
translated: But the gods can descend to Jambudvīpa to listen to the Dharma.”

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' 'dzam bu'i gling du byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' 'dzam bu'i gling du byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva attains perfect enlightenment in Jambudvīpa.

original: de yang byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pa yin @106a *//
analyzed: de yang byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pa yin @106a *//
translated: This is also the bodhisattva’s skillful means.

original: no; ;rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: no; ;rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family!

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dod na dga' ldan gyi gnas nas shi 'phos nas ma'i mngal du ma zhugs shing /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dod na dga' ldan gyi gnas nas shi 'phos nas ma'i mngal du ma zhugs shing /
translated: Moreover, if the bodhisattva wishes, he can die and transmigrate from the Tushita realm and enter his mother’s womb without having entered the womb.

original: mngal gyi dri mas ma reg pa kho nar de'i skad cig de nyid la byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya zhing chos kyi 'khor lo skor bar nus mod kyi /
analyzed: mngal gyi dri mas ma reg pa kho nar de'i skad cig de nyid la byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya zhing chos kyi 'khor lo skor bar nus mod kyi /
translated: Without being touched by the impurities of the womb, he can then manifest complete buddhahood and turn the wheel of Dharma in that very instant.

original: de la sems can kha cig 'di snyam du 'di lha'am /🔽klu'am / gnod sbyin nam /
analyzed: de la sems can kha cig 'di snyam du 'di lha'am / klu'am / gnod sbyin nam /
translated: However, some beings might think, “Is this a god?🔽Is it a nāga, yakṣa,

original: dri za'am / sprul pa zhig gam /
analyzed: dri za'am / sprul pa zhig gam /
translated: gandharva, or a magical creation?

original: 'di ga las 'ongs pa zhig snyam du nem nur dang / yid gnyis dang / the tshom skye bar 'gyur ta /
analyzed: 'di ga las 'ongs pa zhig snyam du nem nur dang / yid gnyis dang / the tshom skye bar 'gyur ta /
translated: Where did it come from?” They would be uncertain, doubtful, and skeptical.

original: de dag nem nur dang / yid gnyis dang / the tshom skye bar gyur na nyon mongs pa yongs su zad par bya ba'i phyir chos nyan par mi byed /
analyzed: de dag nem nur dang / yid gnyis dang / the tshom skye bar gyur na nyon mongs pa yongs su zad par bya ba'i phyir chos nyan par mi byed /
translated: If they are uncertain, doubtful, and skeptical, they will not listen to the Dharma,

original: shes par mi byed /
analyzed: shes par mi byed /
translated: will not understand it,

original: brtson 'grus rtsom par mi byed pas /
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom par mi byed pas /
translated: and will not apply themselves with diligence.

original: byang chub sems dpas mngal na gnas pa bstan pa'i rgyu de yin /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas mngal na gnas pa bstan pa'i rgyu de yin /
translated: This is the reason why the Bodhisattva is said to be in the womb.

original: rkyen de yin no //
analyzed: rkyen de yin no //
translated: This is the cause and this is the condition for the Bodhisattva’s entry into the womb.

original: rigs kyi bu khyod 'di snyam du byang chub sems dpa' mngal gyi gnas su zhugs snyam na khyod kyis de ltar mi blta'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu khyod 'di snyam du byang chub sems dpa' mngal gyi gnas su zhugs snyam na khyod kyis de ltar mi blta'o //
translated: Son of good family, if you think that the Bodhisattva enters the womb, you should not look at it in that way.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin dri ma med pa zhes bya ba yod de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin dri ma med pa zhes bya ba yod de /
translated: There is a Bodhisattva meditative absorption called “Stainless.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' dga' ldan gyi gnas na gnas bzhin du de la snyoms par zhugs shing yongs su bstan nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dga' ldan gyi gnas na gnas bzhin du de la snyoms par zhugs shing yongs su bstan nas /
translated: While the Bodhisattva is dwelling in the Tuṣita realm, he enters into that meditative absorption and demonstrates it.

original: ting nge 'dzin de las ma langs bzhin du dga' ldan gyi gnas nyid nas byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug mod kyi /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de las ma langs bzhin du dga' ldan gyi gnas nyid nas byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug mod kyi /
translated: Without rising from that meditative absorption, he sits at the site of awakening, right there in the Tuṣita realm.

analyzed: dga' ldan gyi lha rnams kyis de na de ma mthong bas byang chub sems dpa'i ting @106b nge 'dzin las langs so snyam du shes par zad do //
translated: But because the Tuṣita gods do not see him there, they think, ‘The Bodhisattva has risen from his meditative absorption.’

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni dga' ldan gyi gnas nas mi g-yo bzhin du sprul pa dag gis 'pho ba dang / skye ba dang / mngon par 'byung ba dang / dka' ba spyod pa'i byang thams cad kun du ston par byed de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni dga' ldan gyi gnas nas mi g-yo bzhin du sprul pa dag gis 'pho ba dang / skye ba dang / mngon par 'byung ba dang / dka' ba spyod pa'i byang thams cad kun du ston par byed de /
translated: The Bodhisattva, without moving from the Tuṣita heaven, manifests all the deeds of a Bodhisattva through emanations: passing away, entering the womb, being born, leaving home, practicing austerities, going to the site of enlightenment, taming the demons, awakening, and turning the wheel of the Dharma.

analyzed: de dag thams cad ni byang chub sems dpas sprul pa dag gis kun tu bstan pa yin no //
translated: All of this is shown by the Bodhisattva through emanations.

analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni kun spyod pa gtsang ba yin pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni kun spyod pa gtsang ba yin pas /
translated: the Bodhisattva has a pure lifestyle,

original: phyir mngal gyi gnas su mi 'gro ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: phyir mngal gyi gnas su mi 'gro ba'i phyir te /

original: de yang byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: This is the Bodhisattva’s skillful means.

analyzed: ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' glang po che thal kar du bsgyur te ma'i mngal du 'jug pa ston par byed ce na /
translated: Why does the Bodhisattva show himself entering the womb as a white elephant?

analyzed: de ni dkar po'i phyogs kyi tshig bla dvags yin no //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa yin pas na / des ni ci nas kyang lha'am /

analyzed: de yang byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pa yin no //

analyzed: ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zla ba bcur ma'i mngal na gnas shing dgur ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why does a bodhisattva stay in his mother’s womb for ten months and not nine?

original: sems can gang dag 'di snyam du /🔽kye ma gzhon nu 'di mngal na gnas pa'i dus yongs su ma rdzogs pas dbang po ma tshang bar gyur to snyam du sems pa'i sems can de dag gi the tshom gcad pa dang / mngal gyi dus dang / dbang po yongs su rdzogs @107a *//
analyzed: sems can gang dag 'di snyam du / kye ma gzhon nu 'di mngal na gnas pa'i dus yongs su ma rdzogs pas dbang po ma tshang bar gyur to snyam du sems pa'i sems can de dag gi the tshom gcad pa dang / mngal gyi dus dang / dbang po yongs su rdzogs @107a *//
translated: There are sentient beings who think,🔽“Alas, this child’s faculties are incomplete because the time he spent in the womb was not complete.”

original: pa kun du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: pa kun du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to eliminate the doubts of those sentient beings and to demonstrate the time in the womb and the complete perfection of the faculties,

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zla ba bcur ma'i mngal na gnas kyi /
translated: the bodhisattva stays in his mother’s womb for ten months.

analyzed: dgur ni ma yin no //
translated: not nine.

translated: When the Bodhisattva has been in his mother’s womb for ten months, gods come to see the Bodhisattva, to pay homage to him, and to honor him.

analyzed: de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' ma'i mngal na gnas pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpa'i longs spyod rin po che bkod pa'i khang pa brtsegs pa lha'i longs spyod thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa mthong nas /
translated: When they see the Bodhisattva’s precious, divine palace, which surpasses all divine and human enjoyments,

original: lha'i bu sa ya phrag gnyis dang / bzhi 'bum gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par gyur te /
analyzed: lha'i bu sa ya phrag gnyis dang / bzhi 'bum gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par gyur te /
translated: two hundred and forty thousand gods give rise to the mind of awakening.

original: de yang byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pa yin no //🔽ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' ma'i mchan brtol te /
analyzed: de yang byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pa yin no // ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' ma'i mchan brtol te /
translated: This is the Bodhisattva’s skillful means.

original: mngal gyi gnas nas 'byung ba kun du ston par byed ce na /
analyzed: mngal gyi gnas nas 'byung ba kun du ston par byed ce na /
translated: Why does the Bodhisattva emerge from his mother’s right side?

original: sems can gang dag 'di snyam du byang chub sems dpa' ni pha dang ma'i mer mer po las skyes pa yin gyi /🔽brdzus te skyes pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa'i sems can de dag the tshom gcad pa'i phyir ma'i mchan brtol te mngal gyi gnas na 'byung ba kun du bstan to //
analyzed: sems can gang dag 'di snyam du byang chub sems dpa' ni pha dang ma'i mer mer po las skyes pa yin gyi / brdzus te skyes pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa'i sems can de dag the tshom gcad pa'i phyir ma'i mchan brtol te mngal gyi gnas na 'byung ba kun du bstan to //
translated: In order to cut through the doubts of those sentient beings who think, “The Bodhisattva was born from the womb of his mother and father,🔽he was not born miraculously,” he emerged from his mother’s right side while she was in the Lumbini Grove, without harming her body.

original: byung ma thag tu yum lha mo sgyu 'phrul gyi lus la yang rma med cing sgros med la /
analyzed: byung ma thag tu yum lha mo sgyu 'phrul gyi lus la yang rma med cing sgros med la /
translated: Immediately after his birth, the body of his mother, Queen Māyā, was unharmed and without wounds.

original: byang chub sems dpa' mngal na gnas pa'i tshe /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mngal na gnas pa'i tshe /
translated: When the Bodhisattva was in his mother’s womb,

original: yum lha mo sgyu 'phrul gyis bde ba myong bar @107b gyur pa gang yin pa de lta bu'i bde ba ni sngon nam yang ma reg cing /🔽sngon nam yang ma myong ba ste /
analyzed: yum lha mo sgyu 'phrul gyis bde ba myong bar @107b gyur pa gang yin pa de lta bu'i bde ba ni sngon nam yang ma reg cing / sngon nam yang ma myong ba ste /
translated: his mother experienced such bliss that she had never felt such bliss before, nor would she ever feel such bliss again.

original: de yang byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: This was due to the Bodhisattva’s skill in means.

original: ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' dgon par btsas shing grong du ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' dgon par btsas shing grong du ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why was the Bodhisattva born in the forest and not in a town?

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni yun ring po nas dgon pa'i bsngags pa brjod pa dang / dben pa la dga' ba dang / kun spyod pa gtsang ba grong du btsas na lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin rnams kyang lha'i phye ma dang / spos dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni yun ring po nas dgon pa'i bsngags pa brjod pa dang / dben pa la dga' ba dang / kun spyod pa gtsang ba grong du btsas na lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin rnams kyang lha'i phye ma dang / spos dang /
translated: For a long time the Bodhisattva had praised the forest, had rejoiced in solitude, and had a pure way of life. If he had been born in a town, the gods, nāgas, and yakṣas would not have made such an exalted offering to him of divine powders, incense,

original: me tog phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / me tog dag gis shin tu 'phags pa'i mchod pa byed par mi 'gyur ba dang; ser skya'i gnas kyi grong khyer na gnas pa'i mi rnams kyang rgyags pa dang bag med pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: me tog phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / me tog dag gis shin tu 'phags pa'i mchod pa byed par mi 'gyur ba dang; ser skya'i gnas kyi grong khyer na gnas pa'i mi rnams kyang rgyags pa dang bag med pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: flower garlands, ointments, and flowers. And the people living in the town of Kapilavastu would have become arrogant and careless.

original: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' dgon par btsas shing grong du ma yin pa'i rgyu ni de yin /
analyzed: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' dgon par btsas shing grong du ma yin pa'i rgyu ni de yin /
translated: This is why the Bodhisattva was born in the forest and not in a town.

original: rkyen ni de yin no //
analyzed: rkyen ni de yin no //
translated: This is the reason, this is the cause.

analyzed: ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i yum gyis shing blag sha'i yal ga la bzung ste /
translated: Why did the Bodhisattva’s mother hold onto a branch of a plakṣa tree?

original: bang mal ma byed par byang chub sems dpa' btsas par byas she na /
analyzed: bang mal ma byed par byang chub sems dpa' btsas par byas she na /
translated: “But why did he not take birth in a bed, but rather on the ground?”

original: sems can gang dag 'di snyam du yum lha mo sgyu 'phrul ni ci lta bur bud med gzhan dag bzhin du sdug bsngal gyi tshor bas reg cing byang chub sems dpa' btsas so snyam du sems pa'i sems can de dag the tshom gcad pa dang bde bar btsas
analyzed: sems can gang dag 'di snyam du yum lha mo sgyu 'phrul ni ci lta bur bud med gzhan dag bzhin du sdug bsngal gyi tshor bas reg cing byang chub sems dpa' btsas so snyam du sems pa'i sems can de dag the tshom gcad pa dang bde bar btsas
translated: In order to cut through the doubts of those sentient beings who think, “The Bodhisattva was born while his mother, the goddess Māyā, was experiencing the pain of a woman,” he demonstrated his birth in comfort.

original: pa kun tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: pa kun tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that he was born in comfort,

analyzed: yum lha mo sgyu 'phrul gyis shing blag sha'i yal ga la bzung ste /
translated: the Bodhisattva was born from his mother’s right side,🔽not from a bed,

analyzed: bang mal ma bcas par @108a *// byang chub sems dpa' btsas par byas so //
translated: but rather on the ground.

analyzed: ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' ma'i mchan g-yas pa brtol te / dran pa dang shes bzhin gyis mngal gyi gnas nas byung zhing skye gnas nas kyang ma yin /
translated: “But why did the Bodhisattva emerge from his mother’s right side,

analyzed: lus kyi phyogs gzhan dag kyang ma yin zhe na /
translated: and not from her womb, or from any other part of her body?”

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni kun spyod pa gtsang ba dang / 'jig rten gsum thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa dang / 'dul ba'i sems can rnams gdul ba'i phyir /
translated: Bodhisattvas have pure conduct, are superior to all in the three worlds, and in order to train those beings who are to be trained,

translated: they must demonstrate birth in such a way that they do not rely on and remain in their mother’s womb like other inferior beings, and they are not born from a womb.

analyzed: des na byang chub sems dpa' ma'i mchan g-yas pa brtol te /
translated: Therefore, the Bodhisattva emerged from his mother’s right side.

analyzed: dran pa dang shes bzhin gyis mngal gyi gnas nas byung zhing /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' btsas ma thag tu yum lha mo sgyu 'phrul gyi mchan yang rma med cing sgros med par gyur te /

analyzed: de yang byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: This is also the Bodhisattva’s skillful means.

analyzed: ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' btsas ma thag tu lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis bzung la /

analyzed: mir gyur pa gzhan dag gis ma yin zhe na /

analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'bar bas lha rnams 'dun par byas pas /

analyzed: de na byang chub @108b sems dpa' la mchod pa'i las rgya chen po la brtson par byed pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, he was the one who made the great offerings to the Bodhisattva,

original: de yang byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: and this was the Bodhisattva’s skillful means.

analyzed: brgyad kyang ma yin zhe na /

analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' btsas ma thag tu yongs su ma bzung bar gom pa bdun 'dor bar byed la /

original: drug kyang ma yin /
analyzed: drug kyang ma yin /

analyzed: brgyad kyang ma yin te; de yang byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: This is the skillful method of the bodhisattva.

analyzed: ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' gom pa bdun 'dor ba ni / tshig 'di skad ces nga ni 'jig rten na thu bo yin no //

analyzed: nga ni 'jig rten na gtso bo yin te /

original: skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba mthar dbyung bar bya'o zhes rjod par byed ce na /
analyzed: skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba mthar dbyung bar bya'o zhes rjod par byed ce na /
translated: “I will put an end to birth, aging, sickness, and death.”

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

analyzed: 'khor de na brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / lha'i bu dbang che par grags pa dag 'dus par gyur te 'khod la /

original: nga rgyal gyis khengs pa de dag 'di snyam du /
analyzed: nga rgyal gyis khengs pa de dag 'di snyam du /
translated: They were filled with pride and thought,

original: bdag cag ni ches bla ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bdag cag ni ches bla ma yin gyi /
translated: ‘We are the most exalted ones.🔽This bodhisattva is not like us.’

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'di ni de lta ma yin no snyam du sems shing @109a *// 'dud par mi byed / rab tu 'dud par mi byed /
translated: They did not bow down,🔽they did not bow down completely,

analyzed: phyag 'tshal bar mi byed /

original: rab tu phyag 'tshal bar mi byed pas na /
analyzed: rab tu phyag 'tshal bar mi byed pas na /
translated: they did not prostrate completely.

original: des na byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: des na byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva thought,

original: brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / lha'i bu 'di dag yun ring por don med pa dang / gnod pa dang / sdug bsngal dang / log par ltung bar 'gyur ro snyam nas de'i phyir byang chub sems dpas tshig 'di skad ces nga ni 'jig rten na thu bo yin no //
analyzed: brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / lha'i bu 'di dag yun ring por don med pa dang / gnod pa dang / sdug bsngal dang / log par ltung bar 'gyur ro snyam nas de'i phyir byang chub sems dpas tshig 'di skad ces nga ni 'jig rten na thu bo yin no //
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva says, ‘I am the foremost in the world.

translated: She made the aspiration prayer in the presence of the Tathāgata Dīpaṃkara:

original: bram ze'i khye'u khyod srid pa tha ma par gyur pa na bdag gi khyim thab tu gyur la /
analyzed: bram ze'i khye'u khyod srid pa tha ma par gyur pa na bdag gi khyim thab tu gyur la /
translated: “Young brahmin, when you become the one in his final existence, may I become your wife.

original: bdag kyang khyod kyi btsun mor gyur cig ces smon lam btab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag kyang khyod kyi btsun mor gyur cig ces smon lam btab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: May I also become your queen.”

original: de'i tshe na byang chub sems dpas kyang 'di skad ces /
analyzed: de'i tshe na byang chub sems dpas kyang 'di skad ces /
translated: At that time the Bodhisattva also said,

original: bzang mo nga ni 'dod pa rnams don du gnyer ba ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: bzang mo nga ni 'dod pa rnams don du gnyer ba ma yin mod kyi /
translated: “Bhadrā, I am not seeking the pleasures of desire.

original: 'on kyang nga khyod kyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du gyur ces autpa la'i phyir khas blangs te /
analyzed: 'on kyang nga khyod kyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du gyur ces autpa la'i phyir khas blangs te /
translated: However, for the sake of the blue lotus, he promised, I will be just as you wish.

original: sangs rgyas kyi spyan sngar dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa de ni mi slu ba yin pas na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi spyan sngar dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa de ni mi slu ba yin pas na /
translated: Since the roots of virtue generated in the presence of the Buddha are infallible,

original: byang chub sems dpas sh'akya'i bu mos 'tsho ma blangs so //🔽gzhan yang byang chub sems @112a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas sh'akya'i bu mos 'tsho ma blangs so // gzhan yang byang chub sems @112a *//
translated: the Bodhisattva accepted Gopā, the Śākya maiden.🔽Moreover, a bodhisattva in his final existence must certainly display a retinue of queens and servants.

original: dpa' srid pa tha ma pas ni btsun mo'i 'khor dang / g-yog 'khor gdon mi za bar kun tu bstan par bya dgos te 'di ltar sh'akya'i bu mo sa 'tsho mas kyang byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs phun sum tshogs pa dang / lha'i mchod pa phun sum tshogs pa dang /
analyzed: dpa' srid pa tha ma pas ni btsun mo'i 'khor dang / g-yog 'khor gdon mi za bar kun tu bstan par bya dgos te 'di ltar sh'akya'i bu mo sa 'tsho mas kyang byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs phun sum tshogs pa dang / lha'i mchod pa phun sum tshogs pa dang /
translated: Thus, the Śākya maiden Gopā saw the Bodhisattva’s perfect form, the perfect offering of the gods,

original: mngon par 'byung ba phun sum tshogs pa mthong nas 'di skad du /
analyzed: mngon par 'byung ba phun sum tshogs pa mthong nas 'di skad du /
translated: and his perfect departure.

original: kye ma bdag kyang yon tan gyi chos 'di lta bu dang ldan par gyur cig ces lhag pa'i bsam pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par gyur pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: kye ma bdag kyang yon tan gyi chos 'di lta bu dang ldan par gyur cig ces lhag pa'i bsam pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par gyur pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because she generated the unsurpassed, perfect mind of enlightenment with the superior intention, Oh, may I also come to possess such virtuous qualities!

original: de ltar na sh'akya'i bu mo sa 'tsho ma byang chub kyi sems brtan par bskyed du gzhug pa'i phyir yang byang chub sems dpas sh'akya'i bu mo sa 'tsho ma blangs so //
analyzed: de ltar na sh'akya'i bu mo sa 'tsho ma byang chub kyi sems brtan par bskyed du gzhug pa'i phyir yang byang chub sems dpas sh'akya'i bu mo sa 'tsho ma blangs so //
translated: Thus, the Bodhisattva took the Śākya maiden Vasudharā as his wife in order to stabilize the mind of enlightenment.

original: gzhan yang sems can gang dag 'dod pa dang / bran dang / chung ma dang / las kyi mtha' dang / khang khyim dang / nor rdzas kyi 'du 'dzis spangs nas yongs su 'dzin pa spangs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang sems can gang dag 'dod pa dang / bran dang / chung ma dang / las kyi mtha' dang / khang khyim dang / nor rdzas kyi 'du 'dzis spangs nas yongs su 'dzin pa spangs te /
translated: Moreover, there are sentient beings who, having abandoned attachment to desires, servants, wives, work, homes, and wealth,

original: rab tu 'byung bar mi nus pa'i sems can de dag la 'dod pa'i sred pa dang / longs spyod dang / nor rdzas dang / chung ma la mi lta bar kun du bstan par bya ba'i phyir yang byang chub sems dpas sh'akya'i bu mo sa 'tsho ma blangs nas khang khyim dang /
analyzed: rab tu 'byung bar mi nus pa'i sems can de dag la 'dod pa'i sred pa dang / longs spyod dang / nor rdzas dang / chung ma la mi lta bar kun du bstan par bya ba'i phyir yang byang chub sems dpas sh'akya'i bu mo sa 'tsho ma blangs nas khang khyim dang /
translated: In order to teach those beings who are unable to go forth, the Bodhisattva took the Śākya girl Gopā as his wife, in order to show that he did not look at sensual pleasures, wealth, possessions, or a wife.

original: nor rdzas dang / chung ma dang / 'khor rnams la mi lta bar spangs te mngon par byung na /
analyzed: nor rdzas dang / chung ma dang / 'khor rnams la mi lta bar spangs te mngon par byung na /
translated: Then, after giving up his home, wealth, wife, and retinue, he went forth.

original: sems can de dag kyang 'di snyam du gzhon nu don thams cad grub pa 'di yang de @112b ltar btsun mo dang / nor rdzas dang / 'khor dang / longs spyod rgya chen po dag la mi lta bar spangs te rab tu byung na de'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can de dag kyang 'di snyam du gzhon nu don thams cad grub pa 'di yang de @112b ltar btsun mo dang / nor rdzas dang / 'khor dang / longs spyod rgya chen po dag la mi lta bar spangs te rab tu byung na de'i phyir /
translated: Those beings thought, “If even the prince Siddhārtha, who gave up his queen, wealth, retinue, and vast enjoyments, went forth,

original: bdag cag kyang ci'i phyir rab tu 'byung bar mi bya snyam du sems par bya ba'i phyir ro ////
analyzed: bdag cag kyang ci'i phyir rab tu 'byung bar mi bya snyam du sems par bya ba'i phyir ro ////
translated: why shouldn’t we go forth?”

original: bam po gsum pa /
analyzed: bam po gsum pa /
translated: PART THREE

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpas sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpas sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na /
translated: Moreover, when the Bodhisattva was previously practicing the conduct of the Bodhisattvas,

original: bud med gzhon nu bsnyen bkur ma gang dag dge ba'i chos rnams kyis yongs su smin par byas shing /
analyzed: bud med gzhon nu bsnyen bkur ma gang dag dge ba'i chos rnams kyis yongs su smin par byas shing /
translated: he ripened many young women who were worthy of honor with virtuous qualities,

original: yid gcugs par gyur pa de dag gis 'di skad ces bdag cag khyod srid pa tha ma par gyur pa'i bar tshun chad kyi btsun mor gyur cig ces smon lam btab pas na /
analyzed: yid gcugs par gyur pa de dag gis 'di skad ces bdag cag khyod srid pa tha ma par gyur pa'i bar tshun chad kyi btsun mor gyur cig ces smon lam btab pas na /
translated: and they became intimate with him. They made the aspiration, “Until you become a buddha, we will become your queens.”

original: de dag gis dkar po'i chos rgya cher sman par bya ba'i phyir yang byang chub sems dpas 'khor rnams blangs te /
analyzed: de dag gis dkar po'i chos rgya cher sman par bya ba'i phyir yang byang chub sems dpas 'khor rnams blangs te /
translated: In order to increase their virtuous qualities, the Bodhisattva accepted them as his retinue.

original: de na byang chub sems dpa' btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang du gnas pas /
analyzed: de na byang chub sems dpa' btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang du gnas pas /
translated: While the Bodhisattva was dwelling in the midst of his harem,

original: bud med bzhi khri nyis stong ni /
analyzed: bud med bzhi khri nyis stong ni /
translated: he ripened forty-two thousand women

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su smin par byas so //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su smin par byas so //
translated: for unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment.

original: lhag ma rnams ni log par mi ltung ba'i chos can du byas te /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni log par mi ltung ba'i chos can du byas te /
translated: He made the rest have the quality of not falling into error.

original: rnam grangs des kyang byang chub sems dpas 'khor rnams blangs so //
analyzed: rnam grangs des kyang byang chub sems dpas 'khor rnams blangs so //
translated: By this method, the Bodhisattva took the retinue.

original: gzhan yang bud med gang dag 'dod chags kyi yongs su gdung ba chen pos yongs su gdung bar gyur pa de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' mthong ma thag tu bdag nyid 'dod chags dang bral bar kun du shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //🔽gzhan yang byang chub sems dpas bdag nyid kyi chu zheng dang / kha dog dang / @113a *//
analyzed: gzhan yang bud med gang dag 'dod chags kyi yongs su gdung ba chen pos yongs su gdung bar gyur pa de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' mthong ma thag tu bdag nyid 'dod chags dang bral bar kun du shes par bya ba'i phyir ro // gzhan yang byang chub sems dpas bdag nyid kyi chu zheng dang / kha dog dang / @113a *//
translated: Moreover, those women who were tormented by the great heat of passion, as soon as they saw the Bodhisattva, they all knew that they were free from passion.🔽Moreover, the Bodhisattva emanated an emanation that was like his own height, complexion,

original: dbyibs ci 'dra ba de 'dra ba'i sprul pa mngon par sprul nas /
analyzed: dbyibs ci 'dra ba de 'dra ba'i sprul pa mngon par sprul nas /
translated: and shape.

original: sprul pa de dang bud med de dag lhan cig dga' ba dang rtse ba dang dga' mgur spyod par byed pa na /
analyzed: sprul pa de dang bud med de dag lhan cig dga' ba dang rtse ba dang dga' mgur spyod par byed pa na /
translated: That emanation and those women together enjoyed, played, and coupled.

original: de dag so so nas 'di snyam du bdag ni byang chub sems dpa' dang lhan cig dga' ba dang rtse ba dang dga' mgur spyod par byed do snyam du sems par zad kyi /
analyzed: de dag so so nas 'di snyam du bdag ni byang chub sems dpa' dang lhan cig dga' ba dang rtse ba dang dga' mgur spyod par byed do snyam du sems par zad kyi /
translated: Each of them thought, “I am enjoying, playing, and coupling with the Bodhisattva.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni bsam gtan gyi dga' ba'i gnas pas gnas par byed do //🔽sprul pa'i 'dod pa'i longs spyod ji lta ba bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mar me mdzad tshun chad nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni bsam gtan gyi dga' ba'i gnas pas gnas par byed do // sprul pa'i 'dod pa'i longs spyod ji lta ba bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mar me mdzad tshun chad nas /
translated: The bodhisattva abides in the bliss of meditation.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i 'dod pa'i longs spyod kyang de dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i 'dod pa'i longs spyod kyang de dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: Just as the emanated enjoyments of desire are, so too should the bodhisattva’s enjoyments of desire be seen.

original: sh'akya'i bu 'dun pa dang / rta bsngags ldan gnyis kyang de gnyis kyi sngon gyi smon lam nyid yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: sh'akya'i bu 'dun pa dang / rta bsngags ldan gnyis kyang de gnyis kyi sngon gyi smon lam nyid yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: The two Śākyas, Nanda and Balabhadra, should be seen as the two bodhisattvas’ previous aspirations.

original: de yang byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de yang byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: This should be seen as the bodhisattvas’ skillful means.

original: ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' shing 'dzam bu'i grib ma la bsam gtan byed ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' shing 'dzam bu'i grib ma la bsam gtan byed ce na /
translated: Why does the bodhisattva meditate in the shade of the Jambu tree?

original: byang chub sems dpa' de na gnas pas lha bye ba phrag bdun cu brtul ba dang / yab dang yum dag yang dag par bstan par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' bdag rab tu 'byung ba'i phyir mngon par 'byung ba dang / shes rab che ba nyid gdon mi za bar kun tu bstan par bya dgos pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de na gnas pas lha bye ba phrag bdun cu brtul ba dang / yab dang yum dag yang dag par bstan par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' bdag rab tu 'byung ba'i phyir mngon par 'byung ba dang / shes rab che ba nyid gdon mi za bar kun tu bstan par bya dgos pa dang /
translated: The bodhisattva was staying there in order to tame seventy million gods, to show his father and mother, to manifest his own departure from home in order to go forth, and to demonstrate his great wisdom.

original: shing 'dzam bu'i grib mas ma btang ba nyid kyang kun du @113b bstan par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: shing 'dzam bu'i grib mas ma btang ba nyid kyang kun du @113b bstan par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: He also wanted to show that the shade of the rose apple tree never leaves him.

original: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' shing 'dzam bu'i grib ma la bsam gtan byed pa'i rgyu ni de yin /
analyzed: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' shing 'dzam bu'i grib ma la bsam gtan byed pa'i rgyu ni de yin /
translated: This is why the bodhisattva was practicing concentration in the shade of the rose apple tree.

original: rkyen ni de yin te /
analyzed: rkyen ni de yin te /
translated: This is the cause and this is the condition.

original: de yang byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: This is also the bodhisattva’s skillful means.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dga' ba dang rtsed mo thams cad don du mi gnyer bar ci'i phyir skyed mos tshal gyi sar byung zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dga' ba dang rtsed mo thams cad don du mi gnyer bar ci'i phyir skyed mos tshal gyi sar byung zhe na /
translated: “Why did the bodhisattva go to the pleasure grove without seeking any of the pleasures and amusements?”

original: rgan po dang / nad pa dang / shi ba kun tu bstan par bya ba dang / nye du rnams kyis 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' ni nye du rnams mi 'dod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rgan po dang / nad pa dang / shi ba kun tu bstan par bya ba dang / nye du rnams kyis 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' ni nye du rnams mi 'dod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: He should show himself to be old, sick, and dead, and to be without desire for his relatives.

original: rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi bas 'jigs shing skrag pa dang / khyim na gnas pa ni nyes pa mang po'i skyon chags pas gnas pa ma yin par rig nas /
analyzed: rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi bas 'jigs shing skrag pa dang / khyim na gnas pa ni nyes pa mang po'i skyon chags pas gnas pa ma yin par rig nas /
translated: He should show that he is afraid of old age, sickness, and death, and that he knows that living in a home is full of many faults.

original: mngon par byung ba yin no zhes shes par 'gyur ba kun du bstan par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyang rga ba dang; na ba dang / 'chi bas 'jigs pa kun du bstan par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: mngon par byung ba yin no zhes shes par 'gyur ba kun du bstan par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyang rga ba dang; na ba dang / 'chi bas 'jigs pa kun du bstan par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: He should show that he has gone forth because he wants to teach all beings about the fear of old age, sickness, and death.

original: de'i phyir na byang chub sems dpa' dga' ba dang rtsed mo don du mi gnyer bar yang skyed mos tshal gyi sar byung ste; de yang byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir na byang chub sems dpa' dga' ba dang rtsed mo don du mi gnyer bar yang skyed mos tshal gyi sar byung ste; de yang byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, although bodhisattvas do not pursue pleasure and play, they go to the parks. This is the bodhisattvas’ skillful means.

original: ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' nam phyed kyi dus kyi tshe mngon par byung la nyin mo ma yin zhe na /🔽sems can rnams gang la gnas na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' nam phyed kyi dus kyi tshe mngon par byung la nyin mo ma yin zhe na / sems can rnams gang la gnas na /
translated: Why does the bodhisattva depart at midnight and not during the day?🔽Because he wants to show that sentient beings

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba dag 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du bstan par bya ba'i phyir te /🔽dkar po'i chos don du gnyer ba'i rigs kyi bus ni bde ba rgya chen po ji snyed @114a *//
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba dag 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du bstan par bya ba'i phyir te / dkar po'i chos don du gnyer ba'i rigs kyi bus ni bde ba rgya chen po ji snyed @114a *//
translated: can increase their roots of virtue while living in the world.🔽The son of good lineage who pursues the bright qualities

original: pa yang yongs su spangs te /
analyzed: pa yang yongs su spangs te /
translated: should give up all the extensive pleasures

original: nam phyed kyi dus kyi tshe na ma dris /
analyzed: nam phyed kyi dus kyi tshe na ma dris /
translated: that he has at midnight.🔽He should depart without hesitation or concern,🔽and give up all the pleasures that he has.

original: mi ltos par mngon par 'byung ba bya ba dang / bde ba'i yo byad ji snyed pa dag kyang yongs su spang bar bya ba dang / dkar po'i phyogs yongs su nyams par mi bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: mi ltos par mngon par 'byung ba bya ba dang / bde ba'i yo byad ji snyed pa dag kyang yongs su spang bar bya ba dang / dkar po'i phyogs yongs su nyams par mi bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: He should not let the bright side decline.

original: de yang byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: This is also the skillful means of the bodhisattva.

original: ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpas skye bo rnams ni lha rnams kyis gnyid log par byas te mngon par byung zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpas skye bo rnams ni lha rnams kyis gnyid log par byas te mngon par byung zhe na /
translated: Why did the Bodhisattva have people put to sleep by the gods when he left home?

original: skye bo rnams ni lha rnams kyis gnyid log par byas pas lha rnams kyis nyes par kun tu bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: skye bo rnams ni lha rnams kyis gnyid log par byas pas lha rnams kyis nyes par kun tu bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because he wanted to show the fault of the gods.

original: byang chub sems dpa' la nye du rnams dang / skye bo rnams tha ba dang zhe sdang gi sems bskyed par gyur na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la nye du rnams dang / skye bo rnams tha ba dang zhe sdang gi sems bskyed par gyur na /
translated: If the Bodhisattva’s relatives and the people had given rise to a mind of anger and hatred,

original: de dag la yun ring bor don med pa dang / gnod pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / log par ltung bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de dag la yun ring bor don med pa dang / gnod pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / log par ltung bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: they would have had a long time of no benefit, harm, suffering, and falling into bad rebirths.

original: de dag gis skye bo rnams lha rnams kyis gnyid log par byas shing /
analyzed: de dag gis skye bo rnams lha rnams kyis gnyid log par byas shing /
translated: The people were put to sleep by the gods.

original: lha rnams kyis sgo phye ste bar snang la khyer bas /
analyzed: lha rnams kyis sgo phye ste bar snang la khyer bas /
translated: The gods opened the gate and carried him off into the sky.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpas ma nyes so zhes shes par gyur na /
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpas ma nyes so zhes shes par gyur na /
translated: If they knew that the Bodhisattva was not at fault,

original: de dag byang chub sems dpa' la dad pa rgya chen po thob par 'gyur bas don gyi dbang de mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag byang chub sems dpa' la dad pa rgya chen po thob par 'gyur bas don gyi dbang de mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: he sees this as the point and so,

original: skye bo rnams gnyid log par byas nas mngon par byung ste /
analyzed: skye bo rnams gnyid log par byas nas mngon par byung ste /
translated: having put the people to sleep, he departs.

original: de yang byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: This is also the bodhisattva’s skillful means.

original: ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpas rta dang rgyan rnams sh'akya'i bu 'dun pa la phyir bskur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpas rta dang rgyan rnams sh'akya'i bu 'dun pa la phyir bskur zhe na /
translated: Why did the bodhisattva return the horse and ornaments to the Śākya boy Cunda?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: chog shes pa @114b kun tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: chog shes pa @114b kun tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: In order to demonstrate contentment,

original: gzhan dag 'di skad ces byang chub sems dpa' ni dngos po thams cad la mi lta bar rab tu byung bas na gser dang dngul dag don du gnyer ba ma yin no zhes brjod par bya ba dang / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpas phyi ma'i skye bo dag rjes su slob tu gzhug par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan dag 'di skad ces byang chub sems dpa' ni dngos po thams cad la mi lta bar rab tu byung bas na gser dang dngul dag don du gnyer ba ma yin no zhes brjod par bya ba dang / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpas phyi ma'i skye bo dag rjes su slob tu gzhug par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: so that others might say, “The bodhisattva went forth without regard for any possessions, so he does not pursue gold and silver,” and also so that the bodhisattva might cause future generations to train in the same way.

original: 'di ltar gang dag bstan pa 'di la rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur ba de dag gis ni nga'i rjes su bslabs shing /🔽dngos po thams cad la mi lta bar 'phags pa'i rigs bzhi la brten nas rab tu 'byung bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang dag bstan pa 'di la rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur ba de dag gis ni nga'i rjes su bslabs shing / dngos po thams cad la mi lta bar 'phags pa'i rigs bzhi la brten nas rab tu 'byung bar bya ste /

analyzed: dge sbyong mgo reg la byang chub ga la yod ces smras kyang /

analyzed: dge sbyong mgo reg la byang chub ga la yod ces smras pa'i rgyu ni de yin /

analyzed: las kyi bya ba de la dmigs nas lo drug tu dka' ba spyad pa bstan to //

original: byang chub sems dpas lo drug tu dka' ba spyad pa bstan pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas lo drug tu dka' ba spyad pa bstan pas /
translated: the Bodhisattva

analyzed: lha dang phyi rol pa'i drang srong ngan pa la mos pa sa ya phrag bzhi dang / nyis 'bum yang kha zas ngan pa des btul nas /

analyzed: de dag gis ye shes mngon par rtogs par 'gyur te /

analyzed: ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpas zas la yongs su longs spyad de /

analyzed: lus kyi stobs dang / shugs dang; mthu yang dag par bskyed nas /

original: de nas ded dpon snying rje chen po dang ldan pa zhes bya ba de gnyid log ste /
analyzed: de nas ded dpon snying rje chen po dang ldan pa zhes bya ba de gnyid log ste /

analyzed: rmi lam rmi ba na rgya mtsho chen po de nyid na gnas pa'i lha gang yin pa des de'i rmi lam du bstan pa /

analyzed: mgron pa de nyid kyi nang nas ming ni 'di zhes bya /

analyzed: gzugs ni 'di 'dra /

analyzed: cha byad dang / kha dog dang dbyibs ni 'di 'dra ba /
translated: such-and-such dress, complexion, and shape,

original: chom rkun pa /
analyzed: chom rkun pa /
translated: a thief,

original: 'khu ba / gzhan gyi nor 'phrog pa zhig 'dug pa des 'di ltar sems bskyed de /
analyzed: 'khu ba / gzhan gyi nor 'phrog pa zhig 'dug pa des 'di ltar sems bskyed de /
translated: a robber, a plunderer of others’ wealth. He has this thought:

original: bdag gis tshong pa 'di dag thams cad srog dang phral la /
analyzed: bdag gis tshong pa 'di dag thams cad srog dang phral la /
translated: ‘I will kill all these merchants,

original: nor rdzas kyi rnam pa 'di dag thams cad khyer te /
analyzed: nor rdzas kyi rnam pa 'di dag thams cad khyer te /
translated: take all this wealth,

original: 'dzam bu'i gling du 'gro'o snyam du sems pas gal te mi @125b 'dis tshong pa 'di dag srog dang phral bar gyur na ni /
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling du 'gro'o snyam du sems pas gal te mi @125b 'dis tshong pa 'di dag srog dang phral bar gyur na ni /
translated: and go to Jambudvīpa.’ If this man were to kill these merchants,

original: de'i tshe sdig pa'i las dam po byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe sdig pa'i las dam po byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: then he would have committed a very serious evil deed.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: 'di ltar tshong pa lnga brgya tsam po 'di dag thams cad ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la yang dag par zhugs shing /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshong pa lnga brgya tsam po 'di dag thams cad ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la yang dag par zhugs shing /
translated: Because all of these five hundred merchants have set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: byang chub las phyir mi ldog pa sha stag yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: byang chub las phyir mi ldog pa sha stag yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: and are irreversible from awakening.

analyzed: gal te mi 'dis byang chub sems dpa' 'di dag bsad par gyur na; de las kyi sgrib pa'i nyes pa des byang chub sems dpa' re re'i phyir yang /
translated: If this man were to kill these bodhisattvas, because of the fault of that karmic obscuration, for the sake of each bodhisattva

original: byang chub sems dpa' gcig gis yun ring po ji srid kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yang dag par bsgrub par 'gyur ba'i yun ring po de srid du sems can dmyal ba chen po rnams su bsreg par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gcig gis yun ring po ji srid kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yang dag par bsgrub par 'gyur ba'i yun ring po de srid du sems can dmyal ba chen po rnams su bsreg par 'gyur bas /
translated: he would burn in the great hells for as long as it would take a bodhisattva to accomplish unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de la ded dpon khyod kyis de lta bu las brten te /
analyzed: de la ded dpon khyod kyis de lta bu las brten te /
translated: Therefore, leader, you should not rely on such a thing.

original: ci nas kyang mi 'dis tshong pa lnga brgya tsam po 'di dag gsad par mi 'gyur ba dang / 'di yang sems can dmyal ba chen po rnams su 'gro bar mi 'gyur ba de lta bu'i thabs la mkhas pa bsam par gyis shig ces bstan to; ;rigs kyi bu /🔽de nas ded dpon snying rje chen po dang ldan pa de sod nas 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: ci nas kyang mi 'dis tshong pa lnga brgya tsam po 'di dag gsad par mi 'gyur ba dang / 'di yang sems can dmyal ba chen po rnams su 'gro bar mi 'gyur ba de lta bu'i thabs la mkhas pa bsam par gyis shig ces bstan to; ;rigs kyi bu / de nas ded dpon snying rje chen po dang ldan pa de sod nas 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: I will think of a skillful means so that this man will not kill these five hundred merchants, and so that he will not go to the great hells.

analyzed: mi 'dis tshong pa lnga brgya tsam po 'di dag kyang gsad par mi 'gyur la /

original: 'di yang sems can dmyal ba chen po rnams su 'gro bar mi 'gyur ba'i thabs ci yod snyam nas de zhag bdun gyi bar du 'dzam bu'i gling du 'gro ba dang / mi mthun pa'i rlung langs te sdod pa'i tshe /🔽zhag bdun du su la @126a *//
analyzed: 'di yang sems can dmyal ba chen po rnams su 'gro bar mi 'gyur ba'i thabs ci yod snyam nas de zhag bdun gyi bar du 'dzam bu'i gling du 'gro ba dang / mi mthun pa'i rlung langs te sdod pa'i tshe / zhag bdun du su la @126a *//
translated: For seven days he thought, If I go to Jambudvīpa, a contrary wind will blow and I will be delayed.

original: yang mi smra bar sems pa la zhugs par gyur pa na de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: yang mi smra bar sems pa la zhugs par gyur pa na de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: For seven days he remained silent, absorbed in thought.🔽Then he thought, What if I were to give my own body to this man to eat?

original: 'di la tshong pa 'di dag kyang gsad par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di la tshong pa 'di dag kyang gsad par mi 'gyur la /
translated: ‘These merchants will not be killed,

original: mi 'di yang sems can dmyal ba chen po rnams su 'gro bar mi 'gyur ba'i thabs ni mi 'di nyid srog dbral bar bya ba ma gtogs par gzhan med do snyam nas de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: mi 'di yang sems can dmyal ba chen po rnams su 'gro bar mi 'gyur ba'i thabs ni mi 'di nyid srog dbral bar bya ba ma gtogs par gzhan med do snyam nas de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: and this man will not go to the great hells. There is no other way than to take this man’s life.’ He thought,

translated: ‘If I tell all the merchants about this, they will kill this man out of hatred,

analyzed: 'di dag thams cad kyang sems can dmyal ba rnams su 'gro bar 'gyur ro snyam nas /
translated: and all of them will go to the hells.’

original: de yang 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de yang 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: He thought,🔽‘

original: 'di ltar bdag gis mi 'di srog dang phral na gzhi des bdag bskal pa 'bum du sems can dmyal ba chen po rnams su bsregs par 'gyur yang bdag gis sems can dmyal ba chen po'i sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba de la spro bar bya'i /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag gis mi 'di srog dang phral na gzhi des bdag bskal pa 'bum du sems can dmyal ba chen po rnams su bsregs par 'gyur yang bdag gis sems can dmyal ba chen po'i sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba de la spro bar bya'i /
translated: If I take this man’s life, I will be burned in the great hells for a hundred thousand eons.

original: tshong pa lnga brgya tsam po 'di dag srog dang bral bar gyur na yang mi rung mi 'di la sdig pa'i las de snyed cig rab tu 'phel bar gyur na yang mi rung bas /
analyzed: tshong pa lnga brgya tsam po 'di dag srog dang bral bar gyur na yang mi rung mi 'di la sdig pa'i las de snyed cig rab tu 'phel bar gyur na yang mi rung bas /
translated: But I would rather experience the suffering of the great hells than let these five hundred merchants lose their lives, or let this man’s evil karma increase.

original: bdag rang gis mi 'di srog dang dbral bar bya'o snyam nas /🔽rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: bdag rang gis mi 'di srog dang dbral bar bya'o snyam nas / rigs kyi bu /
translated: I will take this man’s life myself.’

original: de ltar ded dpon snying rje chen po dang ldan pa des /
analyzed: de ltar ded dpon snying rje chen po dang ldan pa des /
translated: “Noble son, the captain, who was endowed with great compassion,🔽thought,

original: tshong pa lnga brgya tsam po de dag kun tu bsrung ba dang / mi de yang sems can dmyal ba chen po rnams su 'gro ba las kun du bsrung ba'i phyir snying rje chen po de dang / thabs @126b la mkhas pa des bsam bzhin du chom rkun pa'i mi de mdung thung gis btab ste srog dang phral nas /
analyzed: tshong pa lnga brgya tsam po de dag kun tu bsrung ba dang / mi de yang sems can dmyal ba chen po rnams su 'gro ba las kun du bsrung ba'i phyir snying rje chen po de dang / thabs @126b la mkhas pa des bsam bzhin du chom rkun pa'i mi de mdung thung gis btab ste srog dang phral nas /
translated: With that great compassion and skillful means, he intentionally killed the thief with a spear.

original: mgron pa thams cad kyang don grub cing /
analyzed: mgron pa thams cad kyang don grub cing /
translated: All the merchants were successful in their goals,

original: rang rang gi grong khyer du phyin par gyur to //
analyzed: rang rang gi grong khyer du phyin par gyur to //
translated: and they returned to their own cities.

original: rigs kyi bu; de'i tshe de'i dus na ded dpon snying rje chen po dang ldan pa zhes bya bar gyur pa de gzhan zhig yin snyam du khyod yid gnyis dang the tshom za bar gyur na de ltar mi blta'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu; de'i tshe de'i dus na ded dpon snying rje chen po dang ldan pa zhes bya bar gyur pa de gzhan zhig yin snyam du khyod yid gnyis dang the tshom za bar gyur na de ltar mi blta'o //
translated: “Noble son, if you think that the captain Compassionate One at that time, on that occasion, was anyone else, you should think otherwise.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nga nyid de'i tshe de'i dus na ded dpon snying rje chen po dang ldan pa zhes bya ba der gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nga nyid de'i tshe de'i dus na ded dpon snying rje chen po dang ldan pa zhes bya ba der gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: At that time, on that occasion, I was the captain named Compassionate One.

original: tshong pa lnga brgya tsam po gang dag gru bo che de nyid du zhugs par gyur pa de dag ni gang dag bskal pa bzang po 'di la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba /
analyzed: tshong pa lnga brgya tsam po gang dag gru bo che de nyid du zhugs par gyur pa de dag ni gang dag bskal pa bzang po 'di la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba /
translated: The five hundred merchants who had boarded that great ship will be those who will fully awaken to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood in this fortunate eon.🔽

original: bskal pa bzang po'i byang chub sems dpa' lnga brgya yin no //
analyzed: bskal pa bzang po'i byang chub sems dpa' lnga brgya yin no //
translated: The five hundred merchants who were on that ship are the five hundred bodhisattvas of the fortunate eon who will attain the highest, complete enlightenment in this fortunate eon.

analyzed: rigs kyi bu; ngas thabs la mkhas pa de dang / snying rje chen po des bskal pa 'bum du 'khor ba bsnyil te bor bar gyur to //
translated: “Noble son, through that skillful means and great compassion, I eliminated and discarded the cycle of existence for a hundred thousand eons.

original: chom rkun pa de yang de nas shi 'phos nas /
analyzed: chom rkun pa de yang de nas shi 'phos nas /
translated: That thief, after dying,

original: mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du skyes so; ;rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du skyes so; ;rigs kyi bu /
translated: was reborn in the higher realms.

original: 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: 'di ji snyam du sems /

analyzed: gang gi phyir thabs la mkhas pa de dang / snying rje chen po des bskal pa 'bum gyi bar du 'khor ba bsnyil te bor bar gyur pa'i don de /
translated: Because of that skillful means and great compassion, I eliminated and discarded the cycle of existence for a hundred thousand eons.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i las kyi sgrib pa yin par blta snyam na /
translated: If you think that this is a bodhisattva’s karmic obscuration,

analyzed: khyod kyis de ltar mi blta ste /
translated: you should not see it in that way.

translated: You should see it as skill in means.

analyzed: seng ldeng gi tshal pa zhabs la zug par bstan te /
translated: “Noble son, in order to guide beings to engage in karmic actions, the Thus-Gone One, through his skill in means, demonstrated that a splinter of kṣīrikā wood had lodged in his foot.

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la seng ldeng tshal pas zug pa gang yin pa de yang sangs rgyas kyi mthu nyid yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The splinter of kṣīrikā wood that lodged in the Thus-Gone One’s foot should be seen as the power of the Buddha himself.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni rdo rje mkhregs pa ltar mi shigs pa'i sku yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the Thus-Gone One’s body is indestructible, like a diamond.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Noble son,

analyzed: 'on kyang mnyan yod kyi grong khyer chen po 'di nyid na srid pa tha ma pa'i mi nyi shu dang / mi nyi shu po de dag nyid kyi dgra bo mi nyi shu zhig kyang yod par gyur te /
translated: In the great city of Śrāvastī there were twenty people in their final lifetime and twenty enemies of those twenty people.

original: de nas mi dgra bo nyi shu po de dag rang rang gi sgyu dag gis 'di lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa skyes par gyur te /
analyzed: de nas mi dgra bo nyi shu po de dag rang rang gi sgyu dag gis 'di lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa skyes par gyur te /
translated: Then those twenty enemies each had this thought through their own deception:

original: bdag cag gis mdza' bshes ltar bcos te /
analyzed: bdag cag gis mdza' bshes ltar bcos te /
translated: “We should pretend to be friends.

original: rang rang gi dgra bo rnams kyi khyim du zhugs la /
analyzed: rang rang gi dgra bo rnams kyi khyim du zhugs la /
translated: We should enter the homes of our enemies

original: de dag srog dang dbral bar bya'o snyam du bsams te /
analyzed: de dag srog dang dbral bar bya'o snyam du bsams te /
translated: and take their lives.”

original: gcig la gcig tshig tu ni ma smras so //
analyzed: gcig la gcig tshig tu ni ma smras so //
translated: They did not speak these words to each other.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family,

original: de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus /
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus /
translated: then, through the power of the Buddha,

original: srid pa tha ma pa'i mi nyi shu po gang yin pa de dag dang / mi de dag gi dgra bo gsod pa po'i mi nyi shu po gang dag yin pa de dag /
analyzed: srid pa tha ma pa'i mi nyi shu po gang yin pa de dag dang / mi de dag gi dgra bo gsod pa po'i mi nyi shu po gang dag yin pa de dag /
translated: the twenty people in their final lifetime and the twenty enemies of those people, the killers,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ga la ba der dong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ga la ba der dong ngo //
translated: and went to where the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One was.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Noble son,

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis mi bzhi bcu po de dag gdul ba'i dbang gi phyir dang / skye bo phal po @127b che gzhan dag kyang gdul ba'i dbang gi phyir /
analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis mi bzhi bcu po de dag gdul ba'i dbang gi phyir dang / skye bo phal po @127b che gzhan dag kyang gdul ba'i dbang gi phyir /
translated: then the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, in order to guide those forty men and in order to guide other great multitudes of people,

original: gnas brtan mo'u 'gal gyi bu chen po la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gnas brtan mo'u 'gal gyi bu chen po la bka' stsal pa /
translated: said to the elder Mahā­maudgalyāyana:

original: mo'u 'gal gyi bu chen po /
analyzed: mo'u 'gal gyi bu chen po /
translated: ‘Mahā­maudgalyāyana,

original: deng sa phyogs 'di nas seng ldeng gi tshal pa zhig 'byung bar 'gyur te; des de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs g-yas pa'i mthil du zug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: deng sa phyogs 'di nas seng ldeng gi tshal pa zhig 'byung bar 'gyur te; des de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs g-yas pa'i mthil du zug par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas 'di skad ces bka' stsal nas ring po ma lon par de nas de'i mod las phyogs de nyid nas seng ldeng gi tshal pa rnon po mtho gang tsam gyi tshad gcig byung bar gyur to //
translated: Not long after the Tathāgata had said this, a sharp acacia stake, the length of a cubit, appeared right there on the spot.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la gnas brtan mo'u 'gal gyi bu chen pos 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la gnas brtan mo'u 'gal gyi bu chen pos 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the elder Mahā­Maudgalyāyana said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das; bdag gis seng ldeng gi tshal pa 'di 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan du dor bar bgyi lags so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das; bdag gis seng ldeng gi tshal pa 'di 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan du dor bar bgyi lags so //
translated: “Blessed One, I will throw this acacia stake to another world system.”

original: ngas de la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: ngas de la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: I said to him,

original: mo'u 'gal gyi bu chen po khyod kyis seng ldeng gi tshal pa 'di sa phyogs gzhan du 'dor bar mi nus so //
analyzed: mo'u 'gal gyi bu chen po khyod kyis seng ldeng gi tshal pa 'di sa phyogs gzhan du 'dor bar mi nus so //
translated: “Mahā­Maudgalyāyana, you will not be able to throw this acacia stake to another place.”

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Noble son,

original: de nas gnas brtan mo'u 'gal gyi bu chen pos stobs kyi shugs kyis seng ldeng gi tshal pa de bzung ba dang / 'di ltar stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di kha gyen du bltas te rab tu g-yos par gyur kyang /
analyzed: de nas gnas brtan mo'u 'gal gyi bu chen pos stobs kyi shugs kyis seng ldeng gi tshal pa de bzung ba dang / 'di ltar stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di kha gyen du bltas te rab tu g-yos par gyur kyang /
translated: Then the elder Mahāmaudgalyāyana, with the strength of his supernormal powers, took hold of the piece of kṣīraka wood, and the great trichiliocosm turned upside down and shook violently.

original: seng ldeng gi tshal pa de ni tha na skra'i rtse mo'i cha shas tsam yang mi 'gul lo //
analyzed: seng ldeng gi tshal pa de ni tha na skra'i rtse mo'i cha shas tsam yang mi 'gul lo //
translated: But the piece of kṣīraka wood did not move even as much as a hair tip.

original: rigs kyi bu /🔽de nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs kyis rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams kyi gnas su gshegs pa dang / seng ldeng gi tshal pa de yang rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha'i gnas su 'ongs @128a *//

analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa 'thab bral dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams kyi gnas su yang gshegs /

original: tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du yang gshegs pa dang / seng ldeng gi tshal pa de yang tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du 'ongs so //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du yang gshegs pa dang / seng ldeng gi tshal pa de yang tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du 'ongs so //

analyzed: gdan la bzhugs pa dang / seng ldeng gi tshal pa de yang tshangs pa'i 'jig rten nas babs te /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dug go /

analyzed: rtse mo ya gcig sa las gyen du lta ba de'i steng du zhabs bzhag go /

analyzed: de'i rnam par smin pa 'di lta bur gyur lags /

analyzed: ngas de @128b la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: I said to him,

analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: ‘Ānanda,

analyzed: sngon nga rgya mtsho chen po'i nang du song ba na tshong pa g-yo can gcig mdud thung gis btab ste /

analyzed: srog dang phral bar gyur pas 'di ni las de'i lhag ma yin no //
translated: This is the remainder of that karma.’

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Noble son,

analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag cag gi nongs pa la nongs par bshags pa de dag rjes su gzung du gsol zhes nyes pa la nyes par bshags so //

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas de dag la las kyi bya ba dang / las zad par 'gyur ba las brtsams te /

analyzed: de lta de ltar chos bstan pas /
translated: The Tathāgata began to teach them the Dharma, beginning with the performance of actions and the exhaustion of actions.🔽In this way, the forty people

translated: Then the sons of the gods of the Śuddhāvāsa class said to those monks,
