analyzed: kho bo cag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bslab pa las yang dag par 'da' ba'i mthu med cing dbang med pa yin pas /

analyzed: shi bar gyur kyang kho bo cag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bslab pa las yang dag par 'da' bar mi byed do //
translated: Even if we die, we will not transgress the training of the Tathāgata.”

analyzed: de nas gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha'i bu rnams kyis dge slong de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the gods of the Śuddhāvāsa realm said to those monks,

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi bdag po de nyid kyis kyang sman bkus te bor ba spangs nas sman gzhan btsal gyi /

analyzed: khyed cag kyang sman gzhan tshol cig /
translated: You should also seek other medicine.”

analyzed: de nas dge slong de dag 'gyod pa dang bral nas sman gzhan btsal te bstan pa dang / de dag nad de las yongs su thar nas /
translated: Then those monks, free from regret, sought other medicine and taught it, and they were completely cured of that illness.

analyzed: nad dang bral ba de dag gis zhag bdun gyis dgra bcom pa nyid mngon du byas so //

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /

analyzed: gal te de bzhin gshegs pas sman gzhan btsal ba ma mdzad du zin na /
translated: if the Tathāgata had not sought other medicine,

analyzed: dge slong de dag kyang sman gzhan tshol bar mi byed pas /
translated: Those monks will not seek other medicines.

analyzed: skabs ma yin zhing de na gnas med @130a *//
translated: This is not the right time, and there is no place for that.

analyzed: de; de yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i thabs la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: That is also the skillful means of the Tathāgata.

translated: Why did the Tathāgata, who is endowed with all merits, return to the village for alms, as if washing a begging bowl?

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa la ni las kyi sgrib pa cung zad kyang mi mnga' mod kyi /
translated: the Tathāgata does not have even the slightest karmic obscuration.

analyzed: 'on kyang de bzhin gshegs pas ni skye bo phyi ma rnams la thugs brtse ba dang / rjes su bsrung bar bya dgos te /
translated: Nevertheless, the Tathāgata must have compassion for future generations and protect them.

translated: “There are some monks who go to villages, towns, cities, countries, and royal palaces to beg for alms.

analyzed: de dag bdag nyid bsod nams chung bas bsod snyoms mi rnyed pa de'i tshe na /

analyzed: de dag de bzhin gshegs pa yid la byed par 'gyur te /
translated: they think of the Thus-Gone One.

translated: ‘The Thus-Gone One, who is exalted by the splendor of all merits, went to the village to beg for alms. He returned without receiving any alms because his alms bowl was washed clean.

analyzed: bdag cag dge ba'i rtsa ba chung ngu dang ldan pa rnams la lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: What need is there to mention that we, who have little merit, will not receive any alms?’🔽“

analyzed: de bas na bdag cag bsod snyoms ma rnyed pas yid chad pa bskyed par mi bya'o snyam du sems par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Therefore, we should not be discouraged if we do not receive alms.

original: don gyi dbang de gzigs pas na /
analyzed: don gyi dbang de gzigs pas na /
translated: Seeing this,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa bsod snyoms kyi phyir @130b ji ltar lhung bzed bkrus pas grong du zhugs pa bzhin du phyir yang byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa bsod snyoms kyi phyir @130b ji ltar lhung bzed bkrus pas grong du zhugs pa bzhin du phyir yang byung bar gyur to //
translated: the Tathāgata returned from the village as if he had washed his begging bowl,🔽because he had seen this fact.

analyzed: gzhan yang gang la la dag 'di skad ces gang dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa la bsod snyoms ma phul ba'i bram ze dang / khyim bdag de dag ni bdud sdig can gyis byin gyis brlabs so zhes smra na /
translated: Moreover, some people say, “The brahmins and householders who did not offer alms to the Tathāgata were blessed by the evil Māra.”

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Noble sir,

original: de ltar mi blta'o //
analyzed: de ltar mi blta'o //
translated: do not see it that way.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: tshig 'di skad ces /
translated: Why did the Tathāgata say these words:

analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni nye du rnams la phan par bzhed pa yang ma yin /

analyzed: bde bar bzhed par yang ma yin /

analyzed: grub pa dang bde bar bzhed pa yang ma yin no //

analyzed: snyam du sems par mi 'gyur bar sems can de dag gi sems gzung ba'i phyir /

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /

original: gang gi tshe de bzhin gshegs pas gnas brtan kun dga' bo la tshig 'di skad ces /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de bzhin gshegs pas gnas brtan kun dga' bo la tshig 'di skad ces /
translated: when the Tathāgata said to the elder Ānanda,

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /

analyzed: nga klad pa na zhing mi bde'o zhes gsungs pa de'i tshe na /
translated: my head aches and I feel unwell,”

analyzed: lha'i bu chad par smra ba sum stong 'dus par gyur pa dang / sems can srog gcod par rab tu mang po dag kyang 'dus par gyur pas /

original: de na sems can chad par smra ba de dag dang / sems can srog gcod pa de dag las kyi bya ba la gzud pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de na sems can chad par smra ba de dag dang / sems can srog gcod pa de dag las kyi bya ba la gzud pa'i phyir /

analyzed: de na de bzhin gshegs pas gsung gi 'phrin las brjod pa de bstan pa na /

analyzed: lha dang mi rnams kyi skye dgu las srog chags khri btul bar gyur te /

original: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i thabs la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i thabs la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: This was the Thus-Gone One’s skillful means.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: yang na de phyogs gzhan du 'phang ba'am /
analyzed: yang na de phyogs gzhan du 'phang ba'am /
translated: nor did he throw him to the ground,

original: yang na de de bzhin gshegs pa la tshig gcig tsam gyis spyo bar yang mi spobs pa de ltar byin gyi rlabs kyis byin gyis brlab par yang spyod mod kyi /
analyzed: yang na de de bzhin gshegs pa la tshig gcig tsam gyis spyo bar yang mi spobs pa de ltar byin gyi rlabs kyis byin gyis brlab par yang spyod mod kyi /
translated: nor did he scold him back with a single word.

original: 'on kyang 'khor der lha dang mi mang po 'dus par @137a *//
analyzed: 'on kyang 'khor der lha dang mi mang po 'dus par @137a *//

original: gyur pa de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i ma zhum pa dang / ma khengs pa dang / thugs mnyam pa dang / phan pa'i dngos po dang / mnyen pa dang / des  pa dang / sngon gyi ji lta bar phyis kyang de bzhin pas bzod pa'i stobs bskyed pa mthong nas /
analyzed: gyur pa de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i ma zhum pa dang / ma khengs pa dang / thugs mnyam pa dang / phan pa'i dngos po dang / mnyen pa dang / des  pa dang / sngon gyi ji lta bar phyis kyang de bzhin pas bzod pa'i stobs bskyed pa mthong nas /
translated: Seeing the Thus-Gone One’s patience, his power of forbearance, his lack of discouragement, his lack of arrogance, his equanimity, his helpfulness, his gentleness, his patience, and his consistency over time,

analyzed: srog chags bzhi stong gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par gyur te /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas don gyi dbang de gzigs pas na /
translated: The Thus-Gone One saw the significance of this and

analyzed: bram ze bha ra dva dzas spyos pa btang snyoms su bzhag go /

analyzed: des kyang spyo bar byed pa bram ze bha ra dva dza de bzhin gshegs pa la sems dad par gyur nas /

analyzed: sangs rgyas la skyabs su song zhing yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bar gyi sa bon bskyed par gyur te /

original: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i thabs la mkhas pa yin no; ;rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i thabs la mkhas pa yin no; ;rigs kyi bu /

analyzed: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba thams cad dang / srid pa thams cad du lhas byin yang dang yang du rjes su 'brang bar gyur pa de yang byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: Son of noble family, it is also the skillful method of the bodhisattvas that Devadatta has followed them in all their births and existences.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: lhas byin la brten nas nga pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag yongs su rdzogs shing /

analyzed: sems can dpag tu med pa rnams kyi don kyang byas pa'i phyir ro //

original: rnam grangs gang gis she na /
analyzed: rnam grangs gang gis she na /

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

analyzed: 'di la gang gi tshe sems can rnams bde ba dang ldan pa gyur cing / gang gi tshe sbyin pa yang mi shes /

analyzed: 'di ji lta ba bzhin du bdag cag kyang de bzhin du gyur cig /

analyzed: gzhan yang lhas byin dang sems can dpag tu med pa gang dag tshul khrims 'dral bar 'dod pa de dag gis /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' tshul khrims mi 'dral ba mthong nas /

analyzed: de dag la spyos sam / brgyad bkag gam /

analyzed: rnam grangs des kyang sems can rnams kyi don byas pa yin no //
translated: In this way, they will have benefited sentient beings.

analyzed: gang gi tshe lhas byin gyis de bzhin gshegs pa bgrongs pa'i phyir bshed ma ba'i mi dag sbad @138a *//
translated: When Devadatta sent assassins to kill the Tathāgata,

translated: But you should understand that this was the skillful method of the Tathāgata,

original: las kyi sgrib pa'i nyes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: las kyi sgrib pa'i nyes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: and not a fault of karmic obscuration.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: thabs la mkhas pa de la brten nas sems can dpag tu med pa dag gi don mdzad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa de la brten nas sems can dpag tu med pa dag gi don mdzad pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because, relying on that skillful method, he benefited countless beings.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: mdor na lhas byin de ni nga'i ston pa phan par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: mdor na lhas byin de ni nga'i ston pa phan par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: in short, Devadatta was my teacher, who wished to benefit me.

analyzed: las kyi rgyud bcu po thams cad kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i thabs la mkhas pa yin par lta bar bya'i /
translated: You should understand that all ten of these stories are the skillful methods of the Tathāgata,

original: las kyi sgrib pa'i nyes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: las kyi sgrib pa'i nyes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: and not faults of karmic obscuration.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

translated: For the sake of sentient beings who have wasted their karma and its ripening,

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas thabs la mkhas pas / sems can rnams la las che ge mo zhig gi rnam par smin pa ni 'di yin no //
translated: the Tathāgata, through skillful means,🔽teaches that such and such a karma has such and such a ripening.

analyzed: las che ge mo zhig gi rnam par smin pa ni 'di yin no zhes las kyi rgyud kun du bstan te /
translated: He teaches that such and such a karma has such and such a ripening.

translated: When they hear that, sentient beings will not be negligent in engaging in the practice of non-virtuous karma and the obscurations to virtuous karma.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa bstan pa 'di ni gsang bar bya ba yin te /
translated: this teaching on skillful means is to be kept secret.

analyzed: sems can dman @138b pa dge ba'i rtsa ba chung ngu rnams kyi mdun du brjod par mi bya /
translated: It should not be spoken in the presence of those of lesser capacity, those with little root merit.

original: bstan par mi bya /
analyzed: bstan par mi bya /
translated: It should not be taught.

original: bshad par mi bya /
analyzed: bshad par mi bya /
translated: It should not be explained.

original: bklag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bklag par mi bya'o //
translated: It should not be read.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: bstan pa 'di ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis yang ma yin no /

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: de dag ni thabs la mkhas pa 'di la ma bslabs pa'i phyir ro; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de dag la 'dis don du 'gyur ba med de /
analyzed: de dag la 'dis don du 'gyur ba med de /
translated: Because it is not useful for them.

original: thabs la mkhas pa bstan pa 'di'i snod du 'gyur ba dang / gang dag gis bstan pa 'di la bslab par bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ma gtogs par gzhan 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro //

translated: Because there are no others who are vessels for this teaching of skillful means, and because there are no others who should train in this teaching except for the bodhisattva mahāsattvas.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: dper na / mtshan mo mun pa mun gnag gi nang du 'bru mar gyi mar me phyung na /

analyzed: khyim gyi snod thams cad snang bar gyur pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the light of the sun and moon illuminates all the vessels in the house,

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpas kyang thabs la mkhas pa bstan pa 'di thos na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas kyang thabs la mkhas pa bstan pa 'di thos na /
translated: in the same way, when the bodhisattvas hear this teaching on skill in means,

analyzed: sems can thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug par mthong zhing /
translated: they see all sentient beings engaging in the bodhisattva conduct.

original: bdag gis kyang 'di la bslab par byas nas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad dang / sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa thams cad la 'jug cing 'gro bar 'gyur te /🔽de ni legs par yang dag par brtson pas sla'o snyam du sems pa dang / de thabs la mkhas pa de dag la legs par bslabs pa dang / sems can @139a *//
analyzed: bdag gis kyang 'di la bslab par byas nas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad dang / sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa thams cad la 'jug cing 'gro bar 'gyur te / de ni legs par yang dag par brtson pas sla'o snyam du sems pa dang / de thabs la mkhas pa de dag la legs par bslabs pa dang / sems can @139a *//
translated: And they think, ‘Having trained in this, I will also enter and proceed through all the bodhisattva conduct and all the conduct of the buddhas.🔽That is easy for one who is well and truly striving.’

analyzed: rnams smas par mi byed pa de lta bu'i ming du yang 'gyur ro //

original: rigs kyi bu khyod mos par bya /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu khyod mos par bya /
translated: Son of noble family, you should have conviction in this.

original: khyod kyis khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: khyod kyis khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: You should understand this.

original: rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: rigs kyi bu mo byang chub don du gnyer bas ni gang nas thabs la mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di rna lam du grag par 'gyur ba'i dpag tshad 'bum du yang 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo byang chub don du gnyer bas ni gang nas thabs la mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di rna lam du grag par 'gyur ba'i dpag tshad 'bum du yang 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: “Noble sons and daughters who are intent on awakening should go even a hundred thousand leagues to hear this perfection of skill in means taught.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpas thabs la mkhas pa bstan pa 'di thos na snang ba thob par 'gyur zhing /

analyzed: the tshom dang bral ba dang / nem nur dang bral bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and they will be free from doubt and free from uncertainty.”

original: de nas lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten dang / 'khor bzhi po gang dag chos kyi rnam grangs 'di'i snod du gyur pa 'khor der 'dus par gyur pa de dag gis ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di thos par gyur to //
analyzed: de nas lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten dang / 'khor bzhi po gang dag chos kyi rnam grangs 'di'i snod du gyur pa 'khor der 'dus par gyur pa de dag gis ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di thos par gyur to //
translated: Then the world with its gods and the fourfold retinue that had gathered in that assembly, who were vessels for this Dharma discourse, heard this Dharma discourse taught by the Blessed One.

original: gang dag snod du ma gyur cing mi shes pa 'khor der 'dus par gyur pa de dag la ni chos kyi rnam grangs 'di rna lam du grag par yang ma gyur to //
analyzed: gang dag snod du ma gyur cing mi shes pa 'khor der 'dus par gyur pa de dag la ni chos kyi rnam grangs 'di rna lam du grag par yang ma gyur to //
translated: Those who were not vessels for this teaching, who were ignorant, and who had gathered in the retinue, did not hear this Dharma teaching.

original: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bshad pa na srog chags bdun khri nyis stong dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyes so //
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bshad pa na srog chags bdun khri nyis stong dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyes so //
translated: When this Dharma teaching was explained, seventy-two thousand beings gave rise to the mind set on unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Ānanda said to the Bhagavān,

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Bhagavān,

original: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di'i ming ci lags /
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di'i ming ci lags /
translated: what is the name of this Dharma teaching?

original: 'di ji ltar gzung bar bgyi /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar gzung bar bgyi /
translated: How should it be remembered?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

original: thabs la mkhas pa'i le'u zhes bya bar yang gzung zhig /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa'i le'u zhes bya bar yang gzung zhig /

original: thabs la mkhas pa bstan pa zhes bya bar yang gzung zhig /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa bstan pa zhes bya bar yang gzung zhig /
translated: Also, it should be remembered as The Skill in Means.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gsang chen thabs la mkhas pa'i le'u zhes bya bar yang gzung zhig /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gsang chen thabs la mkhas pa'i le'u zhes bya bar yang gzung zhig /
translated: Also, it should be remembered as The Chapter on the Skill in Means of the Great Secret of All the Buddhas.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas /🔽tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ye shes dam pa dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa la yang dag par zhugs pa'i dge bsnyen dang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas / tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ye shes dam pa dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa la yang dag par zhugs pa'i dge bsnyen dang /

translated: The Secret of All Buddhas, Skill in Means,

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ye shes dam pas zhus pa zhes bya ba'i le'u ste /
translated: The Chapter Called Requested by the Bodhisattva Sublime Wisdom.

analyzed: 'dus pa sum cu rtsa brgyad pa rdzogs so ////
